page.title: 14FLOWERS ON ST.MARTINS I.O.S.
page.content: There are 14 flower farms whose size range from one and a half acres to 11 acres.Some of the bigger growers send approximately 3000 boxes in one season,if it is a good year.The season starts in November and carries on until early March. The farmers send their flowers to Covent Garden and markets in other major cities.The flowers are transported to the mainland by ferry,aeroplane or helicopter,then they are taken up to the markets in lorries.The flowers season can be very hard work for the farmers and their wives.The men have to go out to pick the flowers in any weather;when they come back the ladies have to tie the bunches.Later the men have to pack the bunches into boxes until late into the night.The flower industry is vital for the islands economy.
